meanings.definition: Incorrectly attributing something to a source.
meanings.sent1: The misattribution of the painting to the wrong artist caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The misattribution of the quote to the author led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The misattribution of the cat's meow to the dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misattribution of the smell to the flowers was a pleasant mistake.
meanings.sent5: The misattribution of the noise to the wind made the night mysterious.

meanings.definition: The act of mistakenly assigning credit or blame to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her misattribution of the success to luck downplayed her hard work.
meanings.sent2: The misattribution of the achievement to the team effort boosted morale.
meanings.sent3: The misattribution of the mess to the cat saved the guilty puppy.
meanings.sent4: The misattribution of the victory to fate made the win even sweeter.
meanings.sent5: The misattribution of the discovery to chance made the scientist famous.
